title: Jim Banks
added: Banks was first elected to serve in the state senate for the 17th district in 2010, and upon military deployment to [[Afghanistan]], he took a leave of absence from the state senate in September, 2014.<ref>{{cite web|author=Hannah Troyer|author2=Indianapolis Star|author2-link=Indianapolis Star|date=December 8, 2014|title=Amanda Banks fills husband's Senate seat while he's in Afghanistan|url=http://www.indystar.com/story/news/politics/2014/12/08/amanda-banks-fills-husbands-senate-seat-afghanistan/20106935/|publisher=indystar.com}}</ref> Invoking an Indiana state law which allows state and local officeholders to take leaves of absence during active duty military service, Banks was temporarily replaced by his wife, Amanda Banks, who held the office for the senate's 2015 legislative session.<ref>{{cite web|author=Dan Carden|author2=The Times of Northwest Indiana|author2-link=The Times of Northwest Indiana|date=July 9, 2014|title=State senator deploying to Afghanistan|url=http://www.nwitimes.com/content/tncms/assets/v3/eedition/2/35/2355c633-574d-55b7-86ee-925068317ce5/53bca10cbef4c.pdf.pdf|publisher=nwitimes.com}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=Brandon Smith|date=December 16, 2014|title=Amanda Banks Sworn In As New State Senator|url=http://www.wfyi.org/news/articles/amanda-banks-sworn-in-as-new-state-senator|publisher=wfyi.org}}</ref> He returned to Indiana from overseas duty on April 14, 2015<ref>{{cite web|date=April 21, 2015|title=State Senator returns from deployment in Afghanistan|url=http://wane.com/2015/04/21/state-senator-returns-from-deployment-in-afghanistan/|publisher=WANE.com}}</ref> and resumed his duties as state senator on May 8, 2015.<ref>{{cite web|author=Niki Kelly|author2=Fort Wayne Journal Gazette|author2-link=Fort Wayne Journal Gazette|date=May 9, 2015|title=Banks rejoins state Senate after military deployment|url=http://www.journalgazette.net/news/local/indiana/Banks-rejoins-state-Senate-after-military-deployment-6544080|publisher=journalgazette.net}}</ref>
